item.title: Engine Anti-Ice VALVE Lights – Valve Operative

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided associated valve is verified to be operative before operating in known or forecast icing conditions.

note.para: During switch actuation, observe EGT increase on affected engine(s) to verify valve operation. If valve does not appear to operate, avoid icing conditions.

numlitem.para: During switch actuation, observe EGT increase on affected engine(s) to verify valve operation. If valve does not appear to operate, avoid icing conditions.

placard.para: Placard affected light "ENGINE ANTI-ICE VALVE LIGHT INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Prior to flight into icing conditions, verify operation of engine anti-ice valve as follows:
With electrical power on aircraft, station observer at access panels for the engine anti-ice valve as follows:
Turn affected anti-ice switch on and then off. Ground observer should hear solenoid operate. If area is too noisy to hear solenoid, it may be necessary to open access door or cowling.
Restore aircraft to its required configuration.
If valve is inoperative, refer to MEL 30-21-1-1 or 30-21-1-2
